repnme.cdata!:
Ghana - Fourth, Fifth, and Sixth Poverty
            Reduction Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fourth and Fifth Poverty
            Reduction Support Credit (PRSC) Project for Ghana were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Ratings for the Sixth PRSC
            Project were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately unsatisfactory. Some key lessons learned
            included: while there were instances that the PRSC enabled
            the Government to pursue reform policies that will otherwise
            be unaffordable for the country, such as the extension of
            capitation grants and the expansion of the national health
            insurance scheme, there were other instances where the PRSC
            were less successful. Energy sector reforms are a case in
            point. Notwithstanding the Multi-Donor Budget Support (MDBS)
            efforts, the Government implemented these reforms when it
            found fitting to do so. As a result, increases in
            electricity tariffs were gazette but only implemented
            belatedly and when every other source of funding for
            subsidizing consumers had been exhausted. This mix record
            reflects the fact that PRSC are very complex instruments,
            with many dimensions that need to be considered jointly
            (e.g., the fungibility of funds, the centrality of the
            policy dialogue, the nature of conditionalities, donor
            alignment and harmonization). More broadly, however, the
            progress in maintaining prudent fiscal management was not
            sustained once the Ghanaian government no longer had an
            International Monetary Fund (IMF)-sponsored program.

repnme.cdata!: Ghana - Fifth Poverty Reduction Support Credit

abstracts.cdata!:
This Program Document proposes a
            single-tranche Fifth Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC-5) to the Republic of Ghana on standard IDA terms. The
            proposed operation is an integral part o f the Bank's
            strategy to support the implementation of Ghana's
            Growth and Poverty Reduction Strategy (GPRS 11). The
            proposed operation is the second in a second series of four
            such operations, covering the period 2006 to 2009, and would
            facilitate the implementation of cross cutting reforms aimed
            at improving the living conditions of the Ghanaian
            population by promoting private sector led growth,
            encouraging vigorous human development, and strengthening
            governance and civic responsibility.
